english_narration: When the sun shines, the water in ponds and rivers becomes warm.
This warm water slowly changes into vapor and rises into the air.
The vapor forms clouds in the sky. This process is called evaporation.
A tiny seed is planted in the soil. It gets water and sunlight.
Slowly, the seed grows roots and a small green sprout comes out.
With time and care, the sprout becomes a big plant with leaves and flowers.
notes: End happily, like a story finish

english_narration: Farmers grow crops like rice, wheat, and vegetables in their fields.
Animals give us food too, cows give milk, hens give eggs, and fish live in rivers.
All this food helps us grow strong and healthy. We should never waste it.
Sometimes the sun shines bright, and sometimes clouds bring rain.
In the monsoon, rain helps plants grow and fills our rivers.
In some places, the weather becomes cold and snowy. Each season is special.
The heat of the sun makes water from seas and rivers turn into vapor.
The vapor cools down high up in the sky and forms clouds.
When the clouds get heavy, it rains again. The water returns to rivers, this is the water cycle.
Plants make their own food using sunlight, air, and water.
This process is called photosynthesis.
That's why sunlight and water are very important for plants.
The weather keeps changing â€” that's why we have different seasons.
Summer is hot, monsoon brings rain, and winter is cold.
Each season is special and helps nature in its own way.
